column4: i had networking problems on my pc - multiple network cards? is it dual boot? running off a router?
Well it's a laptop so it has a built in modem, ethernet, and wireless but I only enable one at a time.  It's not dual booting and it is going through a router.
The problem i had was with the way my router assigned ips - i had a static one setup. Not sure i can help though its a bit different
it was my first time in here today too - im absolutelty loving ubuntu
Well when I tried it on a different wireless connection without encryption it locked up just when I was typing in the essid so I wasn't even activating it.
Ive heard other people complain about the wireless drivers - you might have to scrouge some forums to find a fix
No possible way to wire it up without wireless for the time being?
Yes, it hangs on ethernet as well
I tried activating it manually via terminal and with the network manager
Oh, I only tried wireless with the live cd because of where I was.  I guess I can try the live cd with ethernet
My ethernet worked with live - but when i booted in it screwed up - i had to change some settings and stuff - only real problem ive had - sorry nothing else i can help you with :(
What kind of stuff did you have to change?

Well i had the convinience of two network cards, one worked other didnt. Had to restart the router so it gave me new DHCP and refreshed in ubuntu. I also played round with the setting for the DNS server. Finnaly got it to work after diabling and then enabling
Alright, well it sounds like I might have to backup everything and downgrade to Breezy
